info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 7:12AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Stillwater, north central Carbon, south central Musselshell, western Yellowstone and southeastern Golden Valley Counties through 800 AM MDT... At 710 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 19 miles southeast of Ryegate to 9 miles north of Joliet. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail, along with a brief period of very heavy rain. Expect ponding of water on streets in the Billings area. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Billings, Laurel, Lockwood, Huntley, Shepherd, Billings Heights, Worden, Billings West End, Ballantine, Broadview, Molt, Acton, Park City and Comanche. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
